title: Use Clear Delimiters
description: Separate distinct parts of the input with clear delimiters
rule: Use triple quotes, XML tags, or section headers to clearly separate different parts of your prompt (context, instructions, examples, input data).
examples:
"""Context"""
You are a helpful assistant.

"""Task"""
Summarize the following text.

"""Text"""
{text}

title: Specify Output Format
description: Tell the model exactly what format you want the output in
rule: Explicitly specify the desired output format (JSON, markdown, bullet points, etc.) and provide an example of the exact structure you expect.
examples: Respond with a JSON object containing: {"summary": string, "key_points": string[], "sentiment": "positive" | "negative" | "neutral"}

title: Provide Few-Shot Examples
description: Show the model what you want through examples
rule: Include 2-3 examples of the desired input-output format before your actual request. This demonstrates the expected behavior and response style.
examples:
Example 1:
Input: The weather is nice today.
Output: positive

Example 2:
Input: I missed my flight.
Output: negative

Now classify:
Input: {user_text}

title: Assign a Persona
description: Give the model a specific role or expertise to adopt
rule: Start your prompt with a role assignment: 'You are an expert [role] with [years] of experience in [domain].' This sets context and improves response quality.
examples: You are a senior software engineer with 15 years of experience in Python and distributed systems. Review the following code for bugs and performance issues.

title: Request Step-by-Step Reasoning
description: Ask the model to think through complex problems systematically
rule: For complex tasks, instruct the model to 'think step by step' or 'show your reasoning before providing the final answer.' This improves accuracy on logical and mathematical problems.
examples:
Think through this problem step by step:
1. First, identify the key variables
2. Then, determine the relationships between them
3. Finally, calculate the answer

title: Specify Length and Detail
description: Be explicit about the desired response length
rule: Specify the expected length (e.g., '2-3 sentences', '500 words', 'brief') and level of detail ('high-level overview' vs 'detailed explanation') you want.

title: Use Positive Instructions
description: Tell the model what TO do rather than what NOT to do
rule: Frame instructions positively. Instead of 'Don't be verbose', say 'Be concise.' Instead of 'Don't make things up', say 'Only use information from the provided context.'
